issue.title: Improve contextual help when editing metadata
issue.body:
**Original author :** Mérour Xavier

Current metadata edition is helped by contextual tips when cursos is "over" class and/or attributes title.
This is a nice feature but uit could be improved :

- for many class/attributes, no help is available. The user does not know it before "flying over" the title. It's kind of annoying.

I would suggest to add a dedicated "pictogram" ("?") which should be only displayed when - and only when - a help content is available. This would ease the work of metadata editors for sur (experience done).

comments.body:
**Original author :** Blatti Yves

That can be done by CSS, which gives the ability to every integrator to deal with it as desired.

(CSS selector : @label[data-original-title]@ or @.com_easysdi_catalog.view-metadata.layout-edit label[data-original-title]@)

Is it OK for you ?

**Original author :** Mérour Xavier

Since it can be done by CSS, I reject this issue.
